page.title: 17PETERSFIELD MUSICAL FESTIVAL
page.content: Petersfield Musical Festival started in 1901. It was one of the first choral festivals, and takes place each year in March in Petersfield Festival Hall. There are concerts by adult and school choirs and orchestras. Up to 200 singers may take part, coming from as far as Southampton, Hayling Island and Whitchurch. The big choirs sing works like Bach's Mass in B minor and Tippet's "A Child of our Time". Smaller choirs sing things like Bach's St.John Passion and the l2th Mass by Mozart. Ladies choirs have competitions during the day and sing together in a concert in the evening. This year they sang "Sea-scapes" by Judith Bailey, a local composer, and recently sang "Mrs. Beeton's Book" by Michael Hurd, who also lives locally.
